ec9c50ce0d8864b331521ac8424cc93d (21:08): Raevel: the problem with that approach (appending a space and putting the value) is that I'm trying to hide and show the element, so onclick it will append the class "hide" and then on another click it will append "show"...that's not too reliable if the classname just gets bigger and bigger...is there a better approach to this?

189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (21:22): shafire check out json

4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (21:23): I used to really really hate autogenerating javascript code with server side code, but when you're just using it to insert JSON it's actually pretty straightforward and nice.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (21:23): (Because it keeps the interface between the two types of code totally clean, which most other combinations of the two don't)
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (21:23): http://json.org
